00293 #ifndef _XMMANAGERS_H
00294 #define _XMMANAGERS_H
00295 /*
00296 ** Include files required:
00297 */
00298 #include <Xm/BulletinB.h>
00299 #include <Xm/Form.h>
00300 #include <Xm/RowColumn.h>
00301 #include <Xm/PanedW.h>

00305 #include "XMWidget.h"

00308 /*
00309 ** The XMManager widget is the superclass of all manager classes.
00310 ** The manager is built as an unmanaged widget to allow the user
00311 ** control over when the manager is managed and realized.
00312 */
00313 
00314 class XMManager : public XMWidget {
00315  public:
00316   /* Constructors */
00317 
00318   XMManager(char *n) : XMWidget(n) {}
00319   XMManager(Widget w) : XMWidget(w) {}
00320   XMManager(char *n,
00321             WidgetClass cl,
00322             XMApplication &parent,
00323             ArgList l= NULL,Cardinal num_args = 0) : XMWidget(n, cl, parent,
00324                                                        l, num_args) {}
00325   XMManager(char *n, WidgetClass cl, Widget parent,
00326             ArgList l=NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00327               XMWidget(n, cl, parent, l, num_args) {}
00328 
00329   XMManager(char *n, WidgetClass cl, XMWidget &parent,
00330              ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00331               XMWidget(n, cl, parent, l, num_args) { }
00332   
00333   /*  The following functions manipulate generic manager resources: */
00334 
00335   Callback_data *AddHelpCallback(void (*callback)(XMWidget *, XtPointer, XtPointer),
00336                   XtPointer client_data) {
00337     return AddCallback(XmNhelpCallback, callback, client_data);
00338   }
00339   void SetNavigationType(XmNavigationType navtype = XmNONE) {
00340     SetAttribute(XmNnavigationType, navtype);
00341   }
00342 
00343   void TraversalOn() {
00344     SetAttribute(XmNtraversalOn, True);
00345   }
00346   void TraverseOff() {
00347     SetAttribute(XmNtraversalOn, (XtArgVal)False);
00348   }
00349 
00350   
00351   /*  The function below is a convenience function to hide the fact that
00352   **  management is actually modified via constraint resources applied to
00353   **  the widget itself rather than by creating, and managing with constraints
00354   */
00355 
00356   void SetConstraint(XMWidget &w, String constraint, XtArgVal value) {
00357     w.SetAttribute(constraint, value);
00358   }
00359   void SetConstraint(XMWidget &w, String constraint, void *value) {
00360     w.SetAttribute(constraint, value);
00361   }
00362   void SetConstraint(Widget w, String constraint, XtArgVal value) {
00363     XtVaSetValues(w, constraint, value, NULL);
00364   }
00365   void SetConstraint(Widget w, String constraint, void *value) {
00366     XtVaSetValues(w, constraint, value, NULL);
00367   }
00368 };
00369 /*
00370 **  The Bulletin board manager allows users to pin items up on arbitrary
00371 **  positions of the bulletin board.  No actual geometry management is 
00372 **  performed by the bulletin board.
00373 */
00374 class XMBulletinBoard : public XMManager {
00375  protected:
00376   XMBulletinBoard(char *n, WidgetClass cl, Widget parent,
00377                   ArgList l, Cardinal num_args) : 
00378                     XMManager(n, cl, parent, l, num_args) {}
00379  public:
00380   /* Constructors: */
00381 
00382   XMBulletinBoard(char *n) : XMManager(n) {}
00383   XMBulletinBoard(Widget w): XMManager(w) {}
00384   XMBulletinBoard(char *n, XMApplication &parent,
00385                   ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00386                     XMManager(n, xmBulletinBoardWidgetClass, parent, 
00387                              l, num_args) {}
00388   XMBulletinBoard(char *n, Widget parent, 
00389                   ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args=0) : 
00390                     XMManager(n, xmBulletinBoardWidgetClass, parent,
00391                              l, num_args) {}
00392   XMBulletinBoard(char *n, XMWidget &parent,
00393                   ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) : 
00394                     XMManager(n, xmBulletinBoardWidgetClass, parent,
00395                              l, num_args) {}
00396   /* The following modify attributes of the bulletin board itself: */
00397 
00398   void AllowOverlap(Boolean allow) {
00399     SetAttribute(XmNallowOverlap, allow);
00400   }
00401   void Margins(Dimension ymargin, Dimension xmargin = 0) {
00402     SetAttribute(XmNmarginHeight, ymargin);
00403     SetAttribute(XmNmarginWidth, xmargin);
00404   }
00405   void SetShadowType(unsigned char type) {
00406     SetAttribute(XmNshadowType, type);
00407   }
00408   /* The following constraints locate the widget: */
00409 
00410   void SetAbsPosition(XMWidget &w, int x, int y) {
00411     SetConstraint(w, XmNx, x);
00412     SetConstraint(w, XmNy, y);
00413   }
00414     
00415 };
00416 /*
00417 ** The frame manager is just a picture frame that can be wrapped around a
00418 ** single widget.  Often this is used around a manager to put a box around
00419 ** some related set of controls.
00420 */
00421 class XMFrame : public XMManager {
00422  public:
00423   /* Constructors: */
00424 
00425   XMFrame(char *name) : XMManager(name) {}
00426   XMFrame(Widget id)  : XMManager(id)   {}
00427   XMFrame(char *n, XMApplication &parent, 
00428           ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) : 
00429             XMManager(n, xmFrameWidgetClass, parent, l, num_args) {}
00430   XMFrame(char *n, XMWidget &parent,
00431           ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00432             XMManager(n, xmFrameWidgetClass, parent, l, num_args) {}
00433   XMFrame(char *n, Widget parent, ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00434     XMManager(n, xmFrameWidgetClass, parent, l, num_args) {}
00435   
00436   /* Set frame attributes: */
00437   
00438   void Margins(Dimension height, Dimension width = 0) {
00439     SetAttribute(XmNmarginWidth, width);
00440     SetAttribute(XmNmarginHeight, height);
00441   }
00442   void SetShadowType(unsigned char type) {
00443     SetAttribute(XmNshadowType, type);
00444   }
00445   
00446 };
00447 /*
00448  ** A form manager is subclassed from the Bulletin board.  It provides
00449  ** a highly flexible layout policy set and automatically positions and
00450  ** repositions widgets as needed top make things work.
00451  */
00452 
00453 class XMForm : public XMBulletinBoard  {
00454  public:
00455   /* Constructors: */
00456   XMForm(char *name) : XMBulletinBoard(name) {}
00457   XMForm(Widget id)  : XMBulletinBoard(id)   {}
00458   XMForm(char *n, XMApplication &parent, 
00459          ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00460            XMBulletinBoard(n, xmFormWidgetClass, parent.getid(), l, num_args)
00461              {}
00462   XMForm(char *n, Widget parent, 
00463          ArgList l=NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00464            XMBulletinBoard(n, xmFormWidgetClass, parent, l, num_args)
00465              {}
00466   XMForm(char *n, XMWidget &parent, 
00467          ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00468            XMBulletinBoard(n, xmFormWidgetClass, parent.getid(), l, num_args) 
00469            {}
00470   
00471   /* Methods  which  set attributes of the form as a whole */
00472 
00473   void SetFractionBase(int n) {
00474     SetAttribute(XmNfractionBase, n);
00475   }
00476   void SetHorizontalSpacing(Dimension n) {
00477     SetAttribute(XmNhorizontalSpacing, n);
00478   }
00479   void SetRubberPositioning(Boolean on) {
00480     SetAttribute(XmNrubberPositioning, on);
00481   }
00482   void SetVerticalSpacing(Dimension n) {
00483     SetAttribute(XmNverticalSpacing, n);
00484   }
00485 
00486   /* Constraint methods.  */
00487 
00488   void SetBottomAttachment(XMWidget &wid, unsigned char method) {
00489     SetConstraint(wid, XmNbottomAttachment, method);
00490   }
00491   void SetBottomAttachment(Widget wid, unsigned char method) {
00492     SetConstraint(wid, XmNbottomAttachment, method);
00493   }
00494 
00495   void SetBottomOffset(XMWidget &wid, int off) {
00496     SetConstraint(wid, XmNbottomOffset, off);
00497   }
00498   void SetBottomPosition(XMWidget &wid, int position) {
00499     SetConstraint(wid, XmNbottomPosition, position);
00500   }
00501   void SetBottomWidget(XMWidget &wid, XMWidget &bound) {
00502     SetConstraint(wid, XmNbottomWidget, bound.getid());
00503   }
00504   void SetBottomWidget(XMWidget &wid, Widget bound) {
00505     SetConstraint(wid, XmNbottomWidget, bound);
00506   }
00507   
00508 
00509   void SetLeftAttachment(XMWidget &wid, unsigned char method) {
00510     SetConstraint(wid, XmNleftAttachment, method);
00511   }
00512   void SetLeftAttachment(Widget wid, unsigned char method) {
00513     SetConstraint(wid, XmNleftAttachment, method);
00514   }
00515   void SetLeftOffset(XMWidget &wid, int offset) {
00516     SetConstraint(wid, XmNleftOffset, offset);
00517   }
00518   void SetLeftPosition(XMWidget &wid, int position) {
00519     SetConstraint(wid, XmNleftPosition, position);
00520   }
00521   void SetLeftWidget(XMWidget &wid, XMWidget &bound) {
00522     SetConstraint(wid, XmNleftWidget, bound.getid());
00523   }
00524   void SetLeftWidget(XMWidget &wid, Widget bound) {
00525     SetConstraint(wid, XmNleftWidget, bound);
00526   }
00527 
00528 
00529   void SetRightAttachment(XMWidget &wid, unsigned char method) {
00530     SetConstraint(wid, XmNrightAttachment, method);
00531   }
00532   void SetRightAttachment(Widget wid, unsigned char method) {
00533     SetConstraint(wid, XmNrightAttachment, method);
00534   }
00535   void SetRightOffset(XMWidget &wid, int offset) {
00536     SetConstraint(wid, XmNrightOffset, offset);
00537   }
00538   void SetRightPosition(XMWidget &wid, int position) {
00539     SetConstraint(wid, XmNrightPosition, position);
00540   }
00541   void SetRightWidget(XMWidget &wid, XMWidget &bound) {
00542     SetConstraint(wid, XmNrightWidget, bound.getid());
00543   }
00544   void SetRightWidget(XMWidget &wid, Widget bound) {
00545     SetConstraint(wid, XmNrightWidget, bound);
00546   }
00547 
00548   void SetTopAttachment(XMWidget &wid, unsigned char method) {
00549     SetConstraint(wid, XmNtopAttachment, method);
00550   }
00551   void SetTopAttachment(Widget wid, unsigned char method) {
00552     SetConstraint(wid, XmNtopAttachment, method);
00553   }
00554   void SetTopOffset(XMWidget &wid, int offset) {
00555     SetConstraint(wid, XmNtopOffset, offset);
00556   }
00557   void SetTopPosition(XMWidget &wid, int position) {
00558     SetConstraint(wid, XmNtopPosition, position);
00559   }
00560   void SetTopWidget(XMWidget &wid, XMWidget &bound) {
00561     SetConstraint(wid, XmNtopWidget, bound.getid());
00562   }
00563   void SetTopWidget(XMWidget &wid, Widget bound) {
00564     SetConstraint(wid, XmNtopWidget, bound);
00565   }
00566   void SetTopWidget(Widget wid, Widget bound) {
00567     SetConstraint(wid, XmNtopWidget, bound);
00568   }
00569   void SetTopWidget(Widget wid, XMWidget &bound) {
00570     SetConstraint(wid, XmNtopWidget, bound.getid());
00571   }
00572 };

00574 /*
00575 ** The Row column widget is subclassed from the XMManager class.  It
00576 ** implements a manager which lays out a regular grid of managed widgets.
00577 ** While it is implicitly used in menu handling, the client should see
00578 ** XMMenus.h for a better way to handle menus than manual construction.
00579 */
00580 class XMRowColumn : public XMManager {
00581  public:
00582   /*  Constructors:  */
00583 
00584   XMRowColumn(char *name) : XMManager(name) {}
00585   XMRowColumn(Widget id)  : XMManager(id)   {}
00586   XMRowColumn(char *name, XMApplication &parent, 
00587               ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00588                 XMManager(name, xmRowColumnWidgetClass, parent, l, num_args) {}
00589   XMRowColumn(char *name, XMWidget &parent,
00590               ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00591                 XMManager(name, xmRowColumnWidgetClass, parent, l, num_args) {}
00592   XMRowColumn(char *name, Widget parent,
00593               ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal num_args = 0) :
00594                 XMManager(name, xmRowColumnWidgetClass, parent, l, num_args) {}
00595 
00596   /* Methods to set the major attributes of a row column widget */
00597 
00598   void SetAlignment(unsigned char alignment) {
00599     SetAttribute(XmNentryAlignment, alignment);
00600   }
00601   void SetEntryClass(WidgetClass type) {
00602     SetAttribute(XmNentryClass, type);
00603   }
00604   void Align(Boolean align) {
00605     SetAttribute(XmNisAligned, align);
00606   }
00607   void SetHomogenous(Boolean homog) {
00608     SetAttribute(XmNisHomogeneous, homog);
00609   }
00610   void Margins(Dimension vertical, Dimension horizontal) {
00611     SetAttribute(XmNmarginHeight, vertical);
00612     SetAttribute(XmNmarginWidth, horizontal);
00613   }
00614 
00615   void SetRowColumns(int numcols) {
00616     SetAttribute(XmNnumColumns, numcols);
00617   }
00618   void SetOrientation(unsigned char orientation) {
00619     SetAttribute(XmNorientation, orientation);
00620   }
00621   void SetPacking(unsigned char packmethod) {
00622     SetAttribute(XmNpacking, packmethod);
00623   }
00624   void RadioMenu()      /* Request toggles be radio buttons */
00625     { SetAttribute(XmNradioBehavior, (XtArgVal)True); }
00626   void RadioForceOne() {
00627     SetAttribute(XmNradioAlwaysOne, (XtArgVal)True); }
00628   void NoRadioMenu() {
00629     SetAttribute(XmNradioBehavior, (XtArgVal)False); }
00630   void RadioNoForceOne() {
00631     SetAttribute(XmNradioAlwaysOne, (XtArgVal)False); }
00632   void SetSpacing(Dimension spacing) {
00633     SetAttribute(XmNspacing, spacing);
00634   }
00635 
00636   
00637   /* Callback methods: */
00638 
00639   Callback_data *AddEntryCallback(void (*callback)(XMWidget *,XtPointer, XtPointer),
00640                         XtPointer client_data) {
00641     return AddCallback(XmNentryCallback, callback, client_data);
00642   }
00643 
00644 };

00694 /*
00695 ** The Main window while not in the Manager classes discussed in O'Reilly's
00696 ** is actually a manager widget which is subclassed from the Manager widget
00697 ** class.  It managers a fixed set of subwidgets in an organization which
00698 ** is similar to that of a Paned Window.
00699 */
00700 class XMMainWindow : public XMManager {
00701  public:
00702   XMMainWindow(char *name) : XMManager(name) {}
00703   XMMainWindow(Widget id)  : XMManager(id  ) {}
00704   XMMainWindow(char *name, XMApplication &parent,
00705                ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal arg_count = 0) :
00706                  XMManager(name, xmMainWindowWidgetClass, parent,
00707                            l, arg_count) {}
00708   XMMainWindow(char *name, XMWidget &parent, 
00709                ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal arg_count  = 0) :
00710                  XMManager(name, xmMainWindowWidgetClass, parent,
00711                            l, arg_count) {}
00712   XMMainWindow(char *name, Widget &parent,
00713                ArgList l = NULL, Cardinal arg_count = 0) :
00714                  XMManager(name, xmMainWindowWidgetClass, parent, 
00715                            l, arg_count) {}
00716 
00717   /*  Modify attributes of the main window: */
00718 
00719   void SetAreas(XMWidget *menubar = NULL, XMWidget *commandwindow = NULL,
00720                 XMWidget *horizontalscroller = NULL,
00721                 XMWidget *verticalscroller = NULL,
00722                 XMWidget *workregion = NULL, XMWidget *messagewidget = NULL);
00723 
00724   void ShowSeparator(Boolean show) {
00725     SetAttribute(XmNshowSeparator, show);
00726   }
00727   void CommandWindowLocation(unsigned char where) {
00728     SetAttribute(XmNcommandWindowLocation, where);
00729   }
00730 
00731 
00732 };
